bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to Edwin F. Uhl, March 30, 1896
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

p.add: ASSISTANT SECRETARY MAY 13 1896 DEPARTMENT OF STATE.
INDEX BUREAU REC'D. MAY 8 1896 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, March 30, 1896.
Mr. Beverly Y. Payne, to the Department of State.
Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, Liberia, March 30, 1896.
Honorable Edwin F. Uhl, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to inform the Department, that the American Merchant Steam Ship "Laurada" burdened 898 tons, arrived at this port on the 23rd instant after a voyage of twenty days from Savannah Georgia, U. S. A. with Three hundred and eighteen colored immigrants from different parts of the United States.
The "Laurada" was chartend by the same international migration company of Birmingham Alabama that sent out immigrants to Liberia in April 1895.
The immigrants this voyage were accompanied

accompanied by Mr. D. J. Flummet, President of the Company; she cleared yesterday for Barbados, West Indies, leaving Mr Flummet at this port. Any further information relating to this subject will be duly reported.
I have the honor to be Sir: your obedient servant.
Beverly Y. Payne, Vice Consul General
